intro: Viscainoa geniculata var. pinnata, commonly known as the creeping indigo or Mexican indigo, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and attractive blue-violet flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Viscainoa geniculata var. pinnata is also valued for its historical use in traditional dyeing practices.
